section.heading: Establishment of the District Waterways Advisory Commission; composition; duties.

para.text: There is established a District Waterways Advisory Commission ("Commission") to advise the Office of District Waterways and to adopt a Waterways Advisory Plan pursuant to § 8-191.03.
The Commission shall be comprised of 14 voting members appointed as follows:

Seven members appointed by the Mayor, with the advice and consent of the Council, pursuant to § 1-523.01(f), one of whom shall be designated as Chairperson. Each appointee shall have experience in at least one of the following areas:
Public safety;
Environmental stewardship;
Economic development or tourism;
Maritime management or policy;
Athletics and recreation; and
Maritime transportation.
Seven members appointed by the Chairman of the Council as follows:
Two Advisory Neighborhood Commissioners, each of whose single-member districts borders a waterway, one from east of the Anacostia River and one from west of the Anacostia River;
Two individuals, each representing a Business Improvement District that borders a waterway, one from east of the Anacostia River and one from west of the Anacostia River; and
Two individuals, each representing a marina or yacht club located in the District; provided, that the individuals do not represent the same marina or yacht club; and
An individual with expertise or interest in waterway management.

Members appointed pursuant to this subsection shall serve for 4-year staggered terms; provided, that of the members initially appointed under this subsection, 4 of the members appointed by the Mayor shall be appointed for a term of 4 years and 3 for a term of one year, and of the members initially appointed by the Chairman of the Council, 4 shall serve for a term of 3 years and 3 shall serve for a term of 2 years.
The government officials who head the following entities, or their designees, shall serve as ex officio non-voting members of the Commission:
The Office of the Deputy Mayor for Planning and Economic Development;
The Office of the Deputy Mayor for Public Safety and Justice;
The Metropolitan Police Department;
The Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department;
The District Department of Transportation;
The Department of Energy and Environment;
The District of Columbia Water and Sewer Authority;
The Washington Convention and Sports Authority;
The Public Service Commission;
The Department of Housing and Community Development; and
The Department of Parks and Recreation.
The Mayor shall request that each of the following federal agencies appoint a representative as an ex officio non-voting member of the Commission:
The National Park Service;
The United States Coast Guard;
The Department of Defense;
The Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority; and
The National Capital Planning Commission.
The Office of Waterways Management shall provide administrative support to the Commission.
The Commission shall meet at least once every 2 months until the first Advisory Plan developed pursuant to § 8-191.03 is published and at least quarterly thereafter.
Proceedings of the Commission are subject to subchapter IV of Chapter 5 of Title 2.
A majority of the members appointed pursuant to subsection (b) of this section shall constitute a quorum.
